segment.source: Chromebook migration guide (Windows 10)
segment.target: Chromebook migration guide (Windows 10)

segment.source: In this guide you will learn how to migrate a Google Chromebook-based learning environment to a Windows 10-based learning environment.
segment.target: In this guide you will learn how to migrate a Google Chromebook-based learning environment to a Windows 10-based learning environment.

segment.source: Chromebook migration guide
segment.target: Chromebook migration guide

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: In this guide you will learn how to migrate a Google Chromebook-based learning environment to a Windows 10-based learning environment.
segment.target: In this guide you will learn how to migrate a Google Chromebook-based learning environment to a Windows 10-based learning environment.

segment.source: You will learn how to perform the necessary planning steps, including Windows device deployment, migration of user and device settings, app migration or replacement, and cloud storage migration.
segment.target: You will learn how to perform the necessary planning steps, including Windows device deployment, migration of user and device settings, app migration or replacement, and cloud storage migration.

segment.source: You will then learn the best method to perform the migration by using automated deployment and migration tools.
segment.target: You will then learn the best method to perform the migration by using automated deployment and migration tools.

segment.source: Plan Chromebook migration
segment.target: Plan Chromebook migration

segment.source: Before you begin to migrate Chromebook devices, plan your migration.
segment.target: Before you begin to migrate Chromebook devices, plan your migration.

segment.source: As with most projects, there can be an urge to immediately start doing before planning.
segment.target: As with most projects, there can be an urge to immediately start doing before planning.

segment.source: When you plan your Chromebook migration before you perform the migration, you can save countless hours of frustration and mistakes during the migration process.
segment.target: When you plan your Chromebook migration before you perform the migration, you can save countless hours of frustration and mistakes during the migration process.

segment.source: In the planning portion of this guide, you will identify all the decisions that you need to make and how to make each decision.
segment.target: In the planning portion of this guide, you will identify all the decisions that you need to make and how to make each decision.

segment.source: At the end of the planning section, you will have a list of information you need to collect and what you need to do with the information.
segment.target: At the end of the planning section, you will have a list of information you need to collect and what you need to do with the information.

segment.source: You will be ready to perform your Chromebook migration.
segment.target: You will be ready to perform your Chromebook migration.

segment.source: Plan for app migration or replacement
segment.target: Plan for app migration or replacement

segment.source: App migration or replacement is an essential part of your Chromebook migration.
segment.target: App migration or replacement is an essential part of your Chromebook migration.

segment.source: In this section you will plan how you will migrate or replace Chromebook (Chrome OS) apps that are currently in use with the same or equivalent Windows apps.
segment.target: In this section you will plan how you will migrate or replace Chromebook (Chrome OS) apps that are currently in use with the same or equivalent Windows apps.

segment.source: At the end of this section, you will have a list of the active Chrome OS apps and the Windows app counterparts.
segment.target: At the end of this section, you will have a list of the active Chrome OS apps and the Windows app counterparts.

segment.source: Identify the apps currently in use on Chromebook devices
segment.target: Identify the apps currently in use on Chromebook devices

segment.source: Before you can do any analysis or make decisions about which apps to migrate or replace, you need to identify which apps are currently in use on the Chromebook devices.
segment.target: Before you can do any analysis or make decisions about which apps to migrate or replace, you need to identify which apps are currently in use on the Chromebook devices.

segment.source: You will create a list of apps that are currently in use (also called an app portfolio).
segment.target: You will create a list of apps that are currently in use (also called an app portfolio).

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The majority of Chromebook apps are web apps.
segment.target: The majority of Chromebook apps are web apps.

segment.source: For these apps you need to first perform Microsoft Edge compatibility testing and then publish the web app URL to the Windows users.
segment.target: For these apps you need to first perform Microsoft Edge compatibility testing and then publish the web app URL to the Windows users.

segment.source: For more information, see the Perform app compatibility testing for web apps section.
segment.target: For more information, see the Perform app compatibility testing for web apps section.

segment.source: You can divide the apps into the following categories:
segment.target: You can divide the apps into the following categories:

segment.source: Apps installed and managed by the institution.
segment.target: Apps installed and managed by the institution.

segment.source: These apps are typically managed in the Apps section in the Google Admin Console.
segment.target: These apps are typically managed in the Apps section in the Google Admin Console.

segment.source: You can record the list of these apps in your app portfolio.
segment.target: You can record the list of these apps in your app portfolio.

segment.source: Apps installed by faculty or students.
segment.target: Apps installed by faculty or students.

segment.source: Faculty or students might have installed these apps as a part of a classroom curriculum.
segment.target: Faculty or students might have installed these apps as a part of a classroom curriculum.

segment.source: Obtain the list of these apps from faculty or students.
segment.target: Obtain the list of these apps from faculty or students.

segment.source: Ensure you only record apps that are legitimately used as a part of classroom curriculum (and not for personal entertainment or use).
segment.target: Ensure you only record apps that are legitimately used as a part of classroom curriculum (and not for personal entertainment or use).

segment.source: Record the following information about each app in your app portfolio:
segment.target: Record the following information about each app in your app portfolio:

segment.source: App name
segment.target: App name

segment.source: App type (such as offline app, online app, web app, and so on)
segment.target: App type (such as offline app, online app, web app, and so on)

segment.source: App publisher or developer
segment.target: App publisher or developer

segment.source: App version currently in use
segment.target: App version currently in use

segment.source: App priority (how necessary is the app to the day-to-day process of the institution or a classroom?
segment.target: App priority (how necessary is the app to the day-to-day process of the institution or a classroom?

segment.source: Rank as high, medium, or low)
segment.target: Rank as high, medium, or low)

segment.source: Throughout the entire app migration or replacement process, focus on the higher priority apps.
segment.target: Throughout the entire app migration or replacement process, focus on the higher priority apps.

segment.source: Focus on lower priority apps only after you have determined what you will do with the higher priority apps.
segment.target: Focus on lower priority apps only after you have determined what you will do with the higher priority apps.

segment.source: Select Google Apps replacements
segment.target: Select Google Apps replacements

segment.source: Table 1 lists the Windows device app replacements for the common Google Apps on Chromebook devices.
segment.target: Table 1 lists the Windows device app replacements for the common Google Apps on Chromebook devices.

segment.source: If your users rely on any of these Google Apps, use the corresponding app on the Windows device.
segment.target: If your users rely on any of these Google Apps, use the corresponding app on the Windows device.

segment.source: Use the information in Table 1 to select the Google App replacement on a Windows device.
segment.target: Use the information in Table 1 to select the Google App replacement on a Windows device.

segment.target: Use this app on a Windows device

segment.target: Google Apps Gmail

segment.source: It may be that you will decide to replace Google Apps after you deploy Windows devices.
segment.target: It may be that you will decide to replace Google Apps after you deploy Windows devices.

segment.source: For more information on making this decision, see the Select cloud services migration strategy section of this guide.
segment.target: For more information on making this decision, see the Select cloud services migration strategy section of this guide.

segment.source: Find the same or similar apps in the Windows Store
segment.target: Find the same or similar apps in the Windows Store

segment.source: In many instances, software vendors will create a version of their app for multiple platforms.
segment.target: In many instances, software vendors will create a version of their app for multiple platforms.

segment.source: You can search the Windows Store to find the same or similar apps to any apps not identified in the Select Google Apps replacements section.
segment.target: You can search the Windows Store to find the same or similar apps to any apps not identified in the Select Google Apps replacements section.

segment.source: In other instances, the offline app does not have a version written for the Windows Store or is not a web app.
segment.target: In other instances, the offline app does not have a version written for the Windows Store or is not a web app.

segment.source: In these cases, look for an app that provides similar functions.
segment.target: In these cases, look for an app that provides similar functions.

segment.source: For example, you might have a graphing calculator offline Android app published on the Chrome OS, but the software publisher does not have a version for Windows devices.
segment.target: For example, you might have a graphing calculator offline Android app published on the Chrome OS, but the software publisher does not have a version for Windows devices.

segment.source: Search the Windows Store for a graphing calculator app that provides similar features and functionality.
segment.target: Search the Windows Store for a graphing calculator app that provides similar features and functionality.

segment.source: Use that Windows Store app as a replacement for the graphing calculator offline Android app published on the Chrome OS.
segment.target: Use that Windows Store app as a replacement for the graphing calculator offline Android app published on the Chrome OS.

segment.source: Record the Windows app that replaces the Chromebook app in your app portfolio.
segment.target: Record the Windows app that replaces the Chromebook app in your app portfolio.

segment.source: Perform app compatibility testing for web apps
segment.target: Perform app compatibility testing for web apps

segment.source: The majority of Chromebook apps are web apps.
segment.target: The majority of Chromebook apps are web apps.

segment.source: Because you cannot run native offline Chromebook apps on a Windows device, there is no reason to perform app compatibility testing for offline Chromebook apps.
segment.target: Because you cannot run native offline Chromebook apps on a Windows device, there is no reason to perform app compatibility testing for offline Chromebook apps.

segment.source: However, you may have a number of web apps that will run on both platforms.
segment.target: However, you may have a number of web apps that will run on both platforms.

segment.source: Ensure that you test these web apps in Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: Ensure that you test these web apps in Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Record the level of compatibility for each web app in Microsoft Edge in your app portfolio.
segment.target: Record the level of compatibility for each web app in Microsoft Edge in your app portfolio.

segment.source: Plan for migration of user and device settings
segment.target: Plan for migration of user and device settings

segment.source: Some institutions have configured the Chromebook devices to make the devices easier to use by using the Google Chrome Admin Console.
segment.target: Some institutions have configured the Chromebook devices to make the devices easier to use by using the Google Chrome Admin Console.

segment.source: You have also probably configured the Chromebook devices to help ensure the user data access and ensure that the devices themselves are secure by using the Google Chrome Admin Console.
segment.target: You have also probably configured the Chromebook devices to help ensure the user data access and ensure that the devices themselves are secure by using the Google Chrome Admin Console.

segment.source: However, in addition to your centralized configuration in the Google Admin Console, Chromebook users have probably customized their device.
segment.target: However, in addition to your centralized configuration in the Google Admin Console, Chromebook users have probably customized their device.

segment.source: In some instances, users may have changed the web content that is displayed when the Chrome browser starts.
segment.target: In some instances, users may have changed the web content that is displayed when the Chrome browser starts.

segment.source: Or they may have bookmarked websites for future reference.
segment.target: Or they may have bookmarked websites for future reference.

segment.source: Or users may have installed apps for use in the classroom.
segment.target: Or users may have installed apps for use in the classroom.

segment.source: In this section, you will identify the user and device configuration settings for your Chromebook users and devices.
segment.target: In this section, you will identify the user and device configuration settings for your Chromebook users and devices.

segment.source: Then you will prioritize these settings to focus on the configuration settings that are essential to your educational institution.
segment.target: Then you will prioritize these settings to focus on the configuration settings that are essential to your educational institution.

segment.source: At the end of this section, you should have a list of Chromebook user and device settings that you want to migrate to Windows, as well as a level of priority for each setting.
segment.target: At the end of this section, you should have a list of Chromebook user and device settings that you want to migrate to Windows, as well as a level of priority for each setting.

segment.source: You may discover at the end of this section that you have few or no higher priority settings to be migrated.
segment.target: You may discover at the end of this section that you have few or no higher priority settings to be migrated.

segment.source: If this is the case, you can skip the Perform migration of user and device settings section of this guide.
segment.target: If this is the case, you can skip the Perform migration of user and device settings section of this guide.

segment.source: Identify Google Admin Console settings to migrate
segment.target: Identify Google Admin Console settings to migrate

segment.source: You use the Google Admin Console (as shown in Figure 1) to manage user and device settings.
segment.target: You use the Google Admin Console (as shown in Figure 1) to manage user and device settings.

segment.source: These settings are applied to all the Chromebook devices in your institution that are enrolled in the Google Admin Console.
segment.target: These settings are applied to all the Chromebook devices in your institution that are enrolled in the Google Admin Console.

segment.source: Review the user and device settings in the Google Admin Console and determine which settings are appropriate for your Windows devices.
segment.target: Review the user and device settings in the Google Admin Console and determine which settings are appropriate for your Windows devices.

segment.target: Table 2 lists the settings in the Device Management node in the Google Admin Console.

segment.target: Review the settings and determine which settings you will migrate to Windows.

segment.target: Settings in the Device Management node in the Google Admin Console

segment.source: Section
segment.target: Section

segment.source: Settings
segment.target: Settings

segment.source: Network
segment.target: Network

segment.source: These settings configure the network connections for Chromebook devices and include the following settings categories:
segment.target: These settings configure the network connections for Chromebook devices and include the following settings categories:

segment.source: Wi-Fi.
segment.target: Wi-Fi.

segment.source: Configures the Wi-Fi connections that are available.
segment.target: Configures the Wi-Fi connections that are available.

segment.source: The Windows devices will need these configuration settings to connect to the same Wi-Fi networks.
segment.target: The Windows devices will need these configuration settings to connect to the same Wi-Fi networks.

segment.source: Ethernet.
segment.target: Ethernet.

segment.source: Configures authentication for secured, wired Ethernet connections (802.1x).
segment.target: Configures authentication for secured, wired Ethernet connections (802.1x).

segment.source: The Windows devices will need these configuration settings to connect to the network.
segment.target: The Windows devices will need these configuration settings to connect to the network.

segment.source: VPN.
segment.target: VPN.

segment.source: Specifies the VPN network connections used by devices when not directly connected to your intranet.
segment.target: Specifies the VPN network connections used by devices when not directly connected to your intranet.

segment.source: The Windows devices will need the same VPN network connections for users to remotely connect to your intranet.
segment.target: The Windows devices will need the same VPN network connections for users to remotely connect to your intranet.

segment.source: Certificates.
segment.target: Certificates.

segment.source: Contains the certificates used for network authentication.
segment.target: Contains the certificates used for network authentication.

segment.source: The Windows devices will need these certificates to connect to the network.
segment.target: The Windows devices will need these certificates to connect to the network.

segment.source: Mobile
segment.target: Mobile

segment.source: These settings configure and manage companion devices (such as smartphones or tablets) that are used in conjunction with the Chromebook devices and include the following settings categories:
segment.target: These settings configure and manage companion devices (such as smartphones or tablets) that are used in conjunction with the Chromebook devices and include the following settings categories:

segment.source: Device management settings.
segment.target: Device management settings.

segment.source: Configures settings for mobile (companion) devices, such as device synchronization, password settings, auditing, enable remote wipe, and other settings.
segment.target: Configures settings for mobile (companion) devices, such as device synchronization, password settings, auditing, enable remote wipe, and other settings.

segment.source: Record these settings so that you can ensure the same settings are applied when the devices are being managed by Microsoft Intune or another mobile device management (MDM) provider.
segment.target: Record these settings so that you can ensure the same settings are applied when the devices are being managed by Microsoft Intune or another mobile device management (MDM) provider.

segment.source: Device activation.
segment.target: Device activation.

segment.source: Contains a list of mobile (companion) devices that need to be approved for management by using the Google Admin Console.
segment.target: Contains a list of mobile (companion) devices that need to be approved for management by using the Google Admin Console.

segment.source: Approve or block any devices in this list so that the list of managed devices accurately reflects active managed devices.
segment.target: Approve or block any devices in this list so that the list of managed devices accurately reflects active managed devices.

segment.source: Managed devices.
segment.target: Managed devices.

segment.source: Performs management tasks on mobile (companion) devices that are managed by the Google Admin Console.
segment.target: Performs management tasks on mobile (companion) devices that are managed by the Google Admin Console.

segment.source: Record the list of companion devices on this page so that you can ensure the same devices are managed by Intune or another MDM provider.
segment.target: Record the list of companion devices on this page so that you can ensure the same devices are managed by Intune or another MDM provider.

segment.source: Set Up Apple Push Certificate.
segment.target: Set Up Apple Push Certificate.

segment.source: Configures the certificate that is essentially the digital signature that lets the Google Admin Console manage iOS devices.
segment.target: Configures the certificate that is essentially the digital signature that lets the Google Admin Console manage iOS devices.

segment.source: You will need this certificate if you plan to manage iOS devices by using Intune or another MDM provider.
segment.target: You will need this certificate if you plan to manage iOS devices by using Intune or another MDM provider.

segment.source: Set Up Android for Work.
segment.target: Set Up Android for Work.

segment.source: Authorizes the Google Admin Console to be the MDM provider for Android devices by providing an Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) token.
segment.target: Authorizes the Google Admin Console to be the MDM provider for Android devices by providing an Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) token.

segment.source: You will need this token if you plan to manage Android devices by using another MDM provider.
segment.target: You will need this token if you plan to manage Android devices by using another MDM provider.

segment.source: Chrome management
segment.target: Chrome management

segment.source: These settings configure and manage companion devices (such as smartphones or tablets) that are used in conjunction with the Chromebook devices and include the following settings categories:
segment.target: These settings configure and manage companion devices (such as smartphones or tablets) that are used in conjunction with the Chromebook devices and include the following settings categories:

segment.source: User settings.
segment.target: User settings.

segment.source: Configures user-based settings for the Chrome browser and Chromebook devices.
segment.target: Configures user-based settings for the Chrome browser and Chromebook devices.

segment.source: Most of these Chromebook user-based settings can be mapped to a corresponding setting in Windows.
segment.target: Most of these Chromebook user-based settings can be mapped to a corresponding setting in Windows.

segment.source: Record the settings and then map them to settings in Group Policy or Intune.
segment.target: Record the settings and then map them to settings in Group Policy or Intune.

segment.source: Public session settings.
segment.target: Public session settings.

segment.source: Configures Public Sessions for Chrome devices that are used as kiosks, loaner devices, shared computers, or for any other work or school-related purpose for which users don't need to sign in with their credentials.
segment.target: Configures Public Sessions for Chrome devices that are used as kiosks, loaner devices, shared computers, or for any other work or school-related purpose for which users don't need to sign in with their credentials.

segment.source: You can configure Windows devices similarly by using Assigned Access.
segment.target: You can configure Windows devices similarly by using Assigned Access.

segment.source: Record the settings and apps that are available in Public Sessions so that you can provide similar configuration in Assigned Access.
segment.target: Record the settings and apps that are available in Public Sessions so that you can provide similar configuration in Assigned Access.

segment.source: Device settings.
segment.target: Device settings.

segment.source: Configures device-based settings for the Chrome browser and Chromebook devices.
segment.target: Configures device-based settings for the Chrome browser and Chromebook devices.

segment.source: You can map most of these Chromebook device-based settings to a corresponding setting in Windows.
segment.target: You can map most of these Chromebook device-based settings to a corresponding setting in Windows.

segment.source: Record the settings and then map them to settings in Group Policy or Intune.
segment.target: Record the settings and then map them to settings in Group Policy or Intune.

segment.source: Devices.
segment.target: Devices.

segment.source: Manages Chrome device management licenses.
segment.target: Manages Chrome device management licenses.

segment.source: The number of licenses recorded here should correspond to the number of licenses you will need for your new management system, such as Intune.
segment.target: The number of licenses recorded here should correspond to the number of licenses you will need for your new management system, such as Intune.

segment.source: Record the number of licenses and use those to determine how many licenses you will need to manage your Windows devices.
segment.target: Record the number of licenses and use those to determine how many licenses you will need to manage your Windows devices.

segment.source: App Management.
segment.target: App Management.

segment.source: Provides configuration settings for Chrome apps.
segment.target: Provides configuration settings for Chrome apps.

segment.source: Record the settings for any apps that you have identified that will run on Windows devices.
segment.target: Record the settings for any apps that you have identified that will run on Windows devices.

segment.source: Basic settings
segment.target: Basic settings

segment.source: These settings configure password management and whether or not two-factor authentication (2FA) is configured.
segment.target: These settings configure password management and whether or not two-factor authentication (2FA) is configured.

segment.source: You can set the minimum password length, the maximum password length, if non-admin users can recover their own passwords, and enable 2FA.
segment.target: You can set the minimum password length, the maximum password length, if non-admin users can recover their own passwords, and enable 2FA.

segment.source: Record these settings and use them to help configure your on-premises Active Directory or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to mirror the current behavior of your Chromebook environment.
segment.target: Record these settings and use them to help configure your on-premises Active Directory or Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) to mirror the current behavior of your Chromebook environment.

segment.source: Password monitoring
segment.target: Password monitoring

segment.source: This section is used to monitor the strength of user passwords.
segment.target: This section is used to monitor the strength of user passwords.

segment.source: You don’t need to migrate any settings in this section.
segment.target: You don’t need to migrate any settings in this section.

segment.source: API reference
segment.target: API reference

segment.source: This section is used to enable access to various Google Apps Administrative APIs.
segment.target: This section is used to enable access to various Google Apps Administrative APIs.

segment.source: You don’t need to migrate any settings in this section.
segment.target: You don’t need to migrate any settings in this section.

segment.source: Set up single sign-on (SSO)
segment.target: Set up single sign-on (SSO)

segment.source: This section is used to configure SSO for Google web-based apps (such as Google Apps Gmail or Google Apps Calendar).
segment.target: This section is used to configure SSO for Google web-based apps (such as Google Apps Gmail or Google Apps Calendar).

segment.source: While you don’t need to migrate any settings in this section, you probably will want to configure Azure Active Directory synchronization to replace Google-based SSO.
segment.target: While you don’t need to migrate any settings in this section, you probably will want to configure Azure Active Directory synchronization to replace Google-based SSO.

segment.source: Advanced settings
segment.target: Advanced settings

segment.source: This section is used to configure administrative access to user data and to configure the Google Secure Data Connector (which allows Google Apps to access data on your local network).
segment.target: This section is used to configure administrative access to user data and to configure the Google Secure Data Connector (which allows Google Apps to access data on your local network).

segment.source: You don’t need to migrate any settings in this section.
segment.target: You don’t need to migrate any settings in this section.

segment.source: Date and time
segment.target: Date and time

segment.source: These settings configure the time zone and if 24-hour clock time should be used.
segment.target: These settings configure the time zone and if 24-hour clock time should be used.

segment.source: Record these settings and configure the Windows device to use these settings.
segment.target: Record these settings and configure the Windows device to use these settings.

segment.source: Privacy
segment.target: Privacy

segment.target: These settings configure Google Chrome web browser privacy settings (such as prediction service, phishing and malware protection, spelling errors, resource pre-fetch, and so on).

segment.source: Record these settings and configure Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, or the web browser of your choice with these settings.
segment.target: Record these settings and configure Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, or the web browser of your choice with these settings.

segment.source: Bluetooth
segment.target: Bluetooth

segment.source: This setting configures whether or not Bluetooth is enabled on the device.
segment.target: This setting configures whether or not Bluetooth is enabled on the device.

segment.source: Record this setting and configure the Windows device similarly.
segment.target: Record this setting and configure the Windows device similarly.

segment.target: Passwords and forms
