segment.target: These settings configure Google Chrome web browser to enable autofill of web forms and to save web passwords.

segment.source: Record these settings and configure Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, or the web browser of your choice with these settings.
segment.target: Record these settings and configure Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, or the web browser of your choice with these settings.

segment.source: Smart lock
segment.target: Smart lock

segment.source: These settings configure the Chromebook when the user’s Android phone is nearby and unlocked, which eliminates the need to type a password.
segment.target: These settings configure the Chromebook when the user’s Android phone is nearby and unlocked, which eliminates the need to type a password.

segment.source: You don’t need to migrate settings in this section.
segment.target: You don’t need to migrate settings in this section.

segment.source: Web content
segment.target: Web content

segment.source: These settings configure how the Chrome web browser displays content (such as font size and page zoom).
segment.target: These settings configure how the Chrome web browser displays content (such as font size and page zoom).

segment.source: Record these settings and configure Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, or the web browser of your choice with these settings.
segment.target: Record these settings and configure Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, or the web browser of your choice with these settings.

segment.source: Languages
segment.target: Languages

segment.source: These settings configure the language in use for the Chromebook.
segment.target: These settings configure the language in use for the Chromebook.

segment.source: Record these settings and configure the Windows device to support the same language.
segment.target: Record these settings and configure the Windows device to support the same language.

segment.source: Downloads
segment.target: Downloads

segment.source: These settings configure the default folder for file download, if the user should be prompted where to save files, and if the Google Drive account should be disconnected.
segment.target: These settings configure the default folder for file download, if the user should be prompted where to save files, and if the Google Drive account should be disconnected.

segment.source: Record these settings and configure the Windows device with similar settings.
segment.target: Record these settings and configure the Windows device with similar settings.

segment.source: HTTPS/SSL
segment.target: HTTPS/SSL

segment.source: These settings configure client-side certificates that are used to authenticate the device.
segment.target: These settings configure client-side certificates that are used to authenticate the device.

segment.source: Depending on the services or apps that use these certificates, you may need to export and then migrate these certificates to the Windows device.
segment.target: Depending on the services or apps that use these certificates, you may need to export and then migrate these certificates to the Windows device.

segment.source: Contact the service or app provider to determine if you can use the existing certificate or if a new certificate needs to be issued.
segment.target: Contact the service or app provider to determine if you can use the existing certificate or if a new certificate needs to be issued.

segment.source: Record these settings and migrate the certificate to the Windows device or enroll for a new certificate as required by the service or app.
segment.target: Record these settings and migrate the certificate to the Windows device or enroll for a new certificate as required by the service or app.

segment.source: Google Cloud Print
segment.target: Google Cloud Print

segment.source: These settings configure the printers that are available to the user.
segment.target: These settings configure the printers that are available to the user.

segment.source: Record the list of printers available to the user and configure the Windows device to have the same printers available.
segment.target: Record the list of printers available to the user and configure the Windows device to have the same printers available.

segment.source: Ensure that the user-friendly printer names in Windows are the same as for the Chromebook device.
segment.target: Ensure that the user-friendly printer names in Windows are the same as for the Chromebook device.

segment.source: For example, if the Chromebook device has a printer named “Laser Printer in Registrar’s Office”, use that same name in Windows.
segment.target: For example, if the Chromebook device has a printer named “Laser Printer in Registrar’s Office”, use that same name in Windows.

segment.source: On startup
segment.target: On startup

segment.source: These settings configure which web pages are opened when the Chrome web browser starts.
segment.target: These settings configure which web pages are opened when the Chrome web browser starts.

segment.source: Record these settings and configure Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, or the web browser of your choice with these settings.
segment.target: Record these settings and configure Microsoft Edge, Internet Explorer, or the web browser of your choice with these settings.

segment.source: Accessibility
segment.target: Accessibility

segment.source: These settings configure the Chromebook ease of use (such as display of large mouse cursor, use of high contrast mode, enablement of the screen magnifier, and so on).
segment.target: These settings configure the Chromebook ease of use (such as display of large mouse cursor, use of high contrast mode, enablement of the screen magnifier, and so on).

segment.source: Record these settings and configure the Windows device with similar settings.
segment.target: Record these settings and configure the Windows device with similar settings.

segment.source: Powerwash
segment.target: Powerwash

segment.source: This action removes all user accounts and resets the Chromebook device back to factory settings.
segment.target: This action removes all user accounts and resets the Chromebook device back to factory settings.

segment.source: You don’t have to migrate any settings in this section.
segment.target: You don’t have to migrate any settings in this section.

segment.source: Reset settings
segment.target: Reset settings

segment.source: This action retains all user accounts, but restores all settings back to their default values.
segment.target: This action retains all user accounts, but restores all settings back to their default values.

segment.source: You don’t have to migrate any settings in this section.
segment.target: You don’t have to migrate any settings in this section.

segment.source: Determine how many users have similar settings and then consider managing those settings centrally.
segment.target: Determine how many users have similar settings and then consider managing those settings centrally.

segment.source: For example, a large number of users may have many of the same Chrome web browser settings.
segment.target: For example, a large number of users may have many of the same Chrome web browser settings.

segment.source: You can centrally manage these settings in Windows after migration.
segment.target: You can centrally manage these settings in Windows after migration.

segment.source: Also, as a part of this planning process, consider settings that may not be currently managed centrally, but should be managed centrally.
segment.target: Also, as a part of this planning process, consider settings that may not be currently managed centrally, but should be managed centrally.

segment.source: Record the settings that are currently being locally managed, but you want to manage centrally after the migration.
segment.target: Record the settings that are currently being locally managed, but you want to manage centrally after the migration.

segment.source: Prioritize settings to migrate
segment.target: Prioritize settings to migrate

segment.source: After you have collected all the Chromebook user, app, and device settings that you want to migrate, you need to prioritize each setting.
segment.target: After you have collected all the Chromebook user, app, and device settings that you want to migrate, you need to prioritize each setting.

segment.source: Evaluate each setting and assign a priority to the setting based on the levels of high, medium, and low.
segment.target: Evaluate each setting and assign a priority to the setting based on the levels of high, medium, and low.

segment.source: Assign the setting-migration priority based on how critical the setting is to the faculty performing their day-to-day tasks and how the setting affects the curriculum in the classrooms.
segment.target: Assign the setting-migration priority based on how critical the setting is to the faculty performing their day-to-day tasks and how the setting affects the curriculum in the classrooms.

segment.source: Focus on the migration of higher priority settings and put less effort into the migration of lower priority settings.
segment.target: Focus on the migration of higher priority settings and put less effort into the migration of lower priority settings.

segment.source: There may be some settings that are not necessary at all and can be dropped from your list of settings entirely.
segment.target: There may be some settings that are not necessary at all and can be dropped from your list of settings entirely.

segment.source: Record the setting priority in the list of settings you plan to migrate.
segment.target: Record the setting priority in the list of settings you plan to migrate.

segment.source: Plan for email migration
segment.target: Plan for email migration

segment.source: Many of your users may be using Google Apps Gmail to manage their email, calendars, and contacts.
segment.target: Many of your users may be using Google Apps Gmail to manage their email, calendars, and contacts.

segment.source: You need to create the list of users you will migrate and the best time to perform the migration.
segment.target: You need to create the list of users you will migrate and the best time to perform the migration.

segment.source: Office 365 supports automated migration from Google Apps Gmail to Office 365.
segment.target: Office 365 supports automated migration from Google Apps Gmail to Office 365.

segment.source: For more information, see Migrate Google Apps mailboxes to Office 365.
segment.target: For more information, see Migrate Google Apps mailboxes to Office 365.

segment.source: Identify the list of user mailboxes to migrate
segment.target: Identify the list of user mailboxes to migrate

segment.source: In regards to creating the list of users you will migrate, it might seem that the answer “all the users” might be the best one.
segment.target: In regards to creating the list of users you will migrate, it might seem that the answer “all the users” might be the best one.

segment.source: However, depending on the time you select for migration, only a subset of the users may need to be migrated.
segment.target: However, depending on the time you select for migration, only a subset of the users may need to be migrated.

segment.source: For example, you may not persist student email accounts between semesters or between academic years.
segment.target: For example, you may not persist student email accounts between semesters or between academic years.

segment.source: In this case you would only need to migrate faculty and staff.
segment.target: In this case you would only need to migrate faculty and staff.

segment.source: Also, when you perform a migration it is a great time to verify that all user mailboxes are active.
segment.target: Also, when you perform a migration it is a great time to verify that all user mailboxes are active.

segment.source: In many environments there are a significant number of mailboxes that were provisioned for users that are no longer a part of the institution (such as interns or student assistants).
segment.target: In many environments there are a significant number of mailboxes that were provisioned for users that are no longer a part of the institution (such as interns or student assistants).

segment.source: You can eliminate these users from your list of user mailboxes to migrate.
segment.target: You can eliminate these users from your list of user mailboxes to migrate.

segment.source: Create your list of user mailboxes to migrate in Excel 2016 based on the format described in step 7 in Create a list of Gmail mailboxes to migrate.
segment.target: Create your list of user mailboxes to migrate in Excel 2016 based on the format described in step 7 in Create a list of Gmail mailboxes to migrate.

segment.source: If you follow this format, you can use the Microsoft Excel spreadsheet to perform the actual migration later in the process.
segment.target: If you follow this format, you can use the Microsoft Excel spreadsheet to perform the actual migration later in the process.

segment.source: Identify companion devices that access Google Apps Gmail
segment.target: Identify companion devices that access Google Apps Gmail

segment.source: In addition to Chromebook devices, users may have companion devices (smartphones, tablets, desktops, laptops, and so on) that also access the Google Apps Gmail mailbox.
segment.target: In addition to Chromebook devices, users may have companion devices (smartphones, tablets, desktops, laptops, and so on) that also access the Google Apps Gmail mailbox.

segment.source: You will need to identify those companion devices and identify the proper configuration for those devices to access Office 365 mailboxes.
segment.target: You will need to identify those companion devices and identify the proper configuration for those devices to access Office 365 mailboxes.

segment.source: After you have identified each companion device, verify the settings for the device that are used to access Office 365.
segment.target: After you have identified each companion device, verify the settings for the device that are used to access Office 365.

segment.source: You only need to test one type of each companion device.
segment.target: You only need to test one type of each companion device.

segment.source: For example, if users use Android phones to access Google Apps Gmail mailboxes, configure the device to access Office 365 and then record those settings.
segment.target: For example, if users use Android phones to access Google Apps Gmail mailboxes, configure the device to access Office 365 and then record those settings.

segment.source: You can publish those settings on a website or to your helpdesk staff so that users will know how to access their Office 365 mailbox.
segment.target: You can publish those settings on a website or to your helpdesk staff so that users will know how to access their Office 365 mailbox.

segment.source: In most instances, users will only need to provide in their Office 365 email account and password.
segment.target: In most instances, users will only need to provide in their Office 365 email account and password.

segment.source: However, you should verify this on each type of companion device.
segment.target: However, you should verify this on each type of companion device.

segment.source: For more information about how to configure a companion device to work with Office 365, see Compare how different mobile devices work with Office 365.
segment.target: For more information about how to configure a companion device to work with Office 365, see Compare how different mobile devices work with Office 365.

segment.source: Identify the optimal timing for the migration
segment.target: Identify the optimal timing for the migration

segment.source: Typically, the best time to perform the migration is between academic years or during semester breaks.
segment.target: Typically, the best time to perform the migration is between academic years or during semester breaks.

segment.source: Select the time of least activity for your institution.
segment.target: Select the time of least activity for your institution.

segment.source: And during that time, the optimal time to perform the migration might be during an evening or over a weekend.
segment.target: And during that time, the optimal time to perform the migration might be during an evening or over a weekend.

segment.source: Ensure that you communicate the time the migration will occur to your users well in advance.
segment.target: Ensure that you communicate the time the migration will occur to your users well in advance.

segment.source: Also, ensure that users know how to access their Office 365 email after the migration is complete.
segment.target: Also, ensure that users know how to access their Office 365 email after the migration is complete.

segment.source: Finally, ensure that your users know how to perform the common tasks they performed in Google Apps Gmail in Office 365 and/or Outlook 2016.
segment.target: Finally, ensure that your users know how to perform the common tasks they performed in Google Apps Gmail in Office 365 and/or Outlook 2016.

segment.source: Plan for cloud storage migration
segment.target: Plan for cloud storage migration

segment.source: Chromebook devices have limited local storage.
segment.target: Chromebook devices have limited local storage.

segment.source: So, most of your users will store data in cloud storage, such as Google Drive.
segment.target: So, most of your users will store data in cloud storage, such as Google Drive.

segment.source: You will need to plan how to migrate your cloud storage as a part of the Chromebook migration process.
segment.target: You will need to plan how to migrate your cloud storage as a part of the Chromebook migration process.

segment.source: In this section, you will create a list of the existing cloud services, select the Microsoft cloud services that best meet your needs, and then optimize your cloud storage services migration plan.
segment.target: In this section, you will create a list of the existing cloud services, select the Microsoft cloud services that best meet your needs, and then optimize your cloud storage services migration plan.

segment.source: Identify cloud storage services currently in use
segment.target: Identify cloud storage services currently in use

segment.source: Typically, most Chromebook users use Google Drive for cloud storage services because your educational institution purchased other Google cloud services and Google Drive is a part of those services.
segment.target: Typically, most Chromebook users use Google Drive for cloud storage services because your educational institution purchased other Google cloud services and Google Drive is a part of those services.

segment.source: However, some users may use cloud storage services from other vendors.
segment.target: However, some users may use cloud storage services from other vendors.

segment.source: For each member of your faculty and staff and for each student, create a list of cloud storage services that includes the following:
segment.target: For each member of your faculty and staff and for each student, create a list of cloud storage services that includes the following:

segment.source: Name of the cloud storage service
segment.target: Name of the cloud storage service

segment.source: Cloud storage service vendor
segment.target: Cloud storage service vendor

segment.source: Associated licensing costs or fees
segment.target: Associated licensing costs or fees

segment.source: Approximate storage currently in use per user
segment.target: Approximate storage currently in use per user

segment.source: Use this information as the requirements for your cloud storage services after you migrate to Windows devices.
segment.target: Use this information as the requirements for your cloud storage services after you migrate to Windows devices.

segment.source: If at the end of this discovery you determine there is no essential data being stored in cloud storage services that requires migration, then you can skip to the Plan for cloud services migration section.
segment.target: If at the end of this discovery you determine there is no essential data being stored in cloud storage services that requires migration, then you can skip to the Plan for cloud services migration section.

segment.source: Optimize cloud storage services migration plan
segment.target: Optimize cloud storage services migration plan

segment.source: Now that you know the current cloud storage services configuration, you need to optimize your cloud storage services migration plan for Microsoft OneDrive for Business.
segment.target: Now that you know the current cloud storage services configuration, you need to optimize your cloud storage services migration plan for Microsoft OneDrive for Business.

segment.source: Optimization helps ensure that your use only the cloud storage services resources that are necessary for your requirements.
segment.target: Optimization helps ensure that your use only the cloud storage services resources that are necessary for your requirements.

segment.source: Consider the following to help optimize your cloud storage services migration plan:
segment.target: Consider the following to help optimize your cloud storage services migration plan:

segment.source: Eliminate inactive user storage.
segment.target: Eliminate inactive user storage.

segment.source: Before you perform the cloud storage services migration, identify cloud storage that is currently allocated to inactive users.
segment.target: Before you perform the cloud storage services migration, identify cloud storage that is currently allocated to inactive users.

segment.source: Remove this storage from your list of cloud storage to migrate.
segment.target: Remove this storage from your list of cloud storage to migrate.

segment.source: Eliminate or archive inactive files.
segment.target: Eliminate or archive inactive files.

segment.source: Review cloud storage to identify files that are inactive (have not been accessed for some period of time).
segment.target: Review cloud storage to identify files that are inactive (have not been accessed for some period of time).

segment.source: Eliminate or archive these files so that they do not consume cloud storage.
segment.target: Eliminate or archive these files so that they do not consume cloud storage.

segment.source: Consolidate cloud storage services.
segment.target: Consolidate cloud storage services.

segment.source: If multiple cloud storage services are in use, reduce the number of cloud storage services and standardize on one cloud storage service.
segment.target: If multiple cloud storage services are in use, reduce the number of cloud storage services and standardize on one cloud storage service.

segment.source: This will help reduce management complexity, support time, and typically will reduce cloud storage costs.
segment.target: This will help reduce management complexity, support time, and typically will reduce cloud storage costs.

segment.source: Record your optimization changes in your cloud storage services migration plan.
segment.target: Record your optimization changes in your cloud storage services migration plan.

segment.source: Plan for cloud services migration
segment.target: Plan for cloud services migration

segment.source: Many of your users may use cloud services on their Chromebook device, such as Google Apps, Google Drive, or Google Apps Gmail.
segment.target: Many of your users may use cloud services on their Chromebook device, such as Google Apps, Google Drive, or Google Apps Gmail.

segment.source: You have planned for these individual cloud services in the Plan for app migration or replacement, Plan for Google Apps Gmail to Office 365 migration, and Plan for cloud storage migration sections.
segment.target: You have planned for these individual cloud services in the Plan for app migration or replacement, Plan for Google Apps Gmail to Office 365 migration, and Plan for cloud storage migration sections.

segment.source: In this section, you will create a combined list of these cloud services and then select the appropriate strategy to migrate these cloud services.
segment.target: In this section, you will create a combined list of these cloud services and then select the appropriate strategy to migrate these cloud services.

segment.source: Identify cloud services currently in use
segment.target: Identify cloud services currently in use

segment.source: You have already identified the individual cloud services that are currently in use in your educational institution in the Plan for app migration or replacement, Plan for Google Apps Gmail to Office 365 migration, and Plan for cloud storage migration sections.
segment.target: You have already identified the individual cloud services that are currently in use in your educational institution in the Plan for app migration or replacement, Plan for Google Apps Gmail to Office 365 migration, and Plan for cloud storage migration sections.

segment.source: Create a unified list of these cloud services and record the following about each service:
segment.target: Create a unified list of these cloud services and record the following about each service:

segment.source: Cloud service name
segment.target: Cloud service name

segment.source: Cloud service provider
segment.target: Cloud service provider

segment.source: Number of users that use the cloud service
segment.target: Number of users that use the cloud service

segment.source: Select cloud services to migrate
segment.target: Select cloud services to migrate

segment.source: One of the first questions you should ask after you identify the cloud services currently in use is, “Why do we need to migrate from these cloud services?”
segment.target: One of the first questions you should ask after you identify the cloud services currently in use is, “Why do we need to migrate from these cloud services?”

segment.source: The answer to this question largely comes down to finances and features.
segment.target: The answer to this question largely comes down to finances and features.

segment.source: Here is a list of reasons that describe why you might want to migrate from an existing cloud service to Microsoft cloud services:
segment.target: Here is a list of reasons that describe why you might want to migrate from an existing cloud service to Microsoft cloud services:

segment.source: Better integration with Office 365.
segment.target: Better integration with Office 365.

segment.source: If your long-term strategy is to migrate to Office 365 apps (such as Word 2016 or Excel 2016) then a migration to Microsoft cloud services will provide better integration with these apps.
segment.target: If your long-term strategy is to migrate to Office 365 apps (such as Word 2016 or Excel 2016) then a migration to Microsoft cloud services will provide better integration with these apps.

segment.source: The use of existing cloud services may not be as intuitive for users.
segment.target: The use of existing cloud services may not be as intuitive for users.

segment.source: For example, Office 365 apps will integrate better with OneDrive for Business compared to Google Drive.
segment.target: For example, Office 365 apps will integrate better with OneDrive for Business compared to Google Drive.

segment.source: Online apps offer better document compatibility.
segment.target: Online apps offer better document compatibility.

segment.source: Microsoft Office online apps (such as Word Online and Excel Online) provide the highest level of compatibility with Microsoft Office documents.
segment.target: Microsoft Office online apps (such as Word Online and Excel Online) provide the highest level of compatibility with Microsoft Office documents.

segment.source: The Office online apps allow you to open and edit documents directly from SharePoint or OneDrive for Business.
segment.target: The Office online apps allow you to open and edit documents directly from SharePoint or OneDrive for Business.

segment.source: Users can access the Office online app from any device with Internet connectivity.
segment.target: Users can access the Office online app from any device with Internet connectivity.

segment.source: Reduce licensing costs.
segment.target: Reduce licensing costs.

segment.source: If you pay for Office 365 licenses, then Office 365 apps and cloud storage are included in those licenses.
segment.target: If you pay for Office 365 licenses, then Office 365 apps and cloud storage are included in those licenses.

segment.source: Although you could keep existing cloud services, you probably would pay more to keep those services.
segment.target: Although you could keep existing cloud services, you probably would pay more to keep those services.

segment.source: Improve storage capacity and cross-platform features.
segment.target: Improve storage capacity and cross-platform features.

segment.source: Microsoft cloud services provide competitive storage capacity and provide more Windows-centric features than other cloud services providers.
segment.target: Microsoft cloud services provide competitive storage capacity and provide more Windows-centric features than other cloud services providers.

segment.source: While the Microsoft cloud services user experience is highly optimized for Windows devices, Microsoft cloud services are also highly optimized for companion devices (such as iOS or Android devices).
segment.target: While the Microsoft cloud services user experience is highly optimized for Windows devices, Microsoft cloud services are also highly optimized for companion devices (such as iOS or Android devices).

segment.source: Review the list of existing cloud services that you created in the Identify cloud services currently in use section and identify the cloud services that you want to migrate to Microsoft cloud services.
segment.target: Review the list of existing cloud services that you created in the Identify cloud services currently in use section and identify the cloud services that you want to migrate to Microsoft cloud services.

segment.source: If you determine at the end of this task that there are no cloud services to be migrated, then skip to the Plan for Windows device deployment section.
segment.target: If you determine at the end of this task that there are no cloud services to be migrated, then skip to the Plan for Windows device deployment section.

segment.source: Also, skip the Perform cloud services migration section later in this guide.
segment.target: Also, skip the Perform cloud services migration section later in this guide.

segment.source: Prioritize cloud services
segment.target: Prioritize cloud services

segment.source: After you have created your aggregated list of cloud services currently in use by Chromebook users, prioritize each cloud service.
segment.target: After you have created your aggregated list of cloud services currently in use by Chromebook users, prioritize each cloud service.

segment.source: Evaluate each cloud service and assign a priority based on the levels of high, medium, and low.
segment.target: Evaluate each cloud service and assign a priority based on the levels of high, medium, and low.

segment.source: Assign the priority based on how critical the cloud service is to the faculty and staff performing their day-to-day tasks and how the cloud service affects the curriculum in the classrooms.
segment.target: Assign the priority based on how critical the cloud service is to the faculty and staff performing their day-to-day tasks and how the cloud service affects the curriculum in the classrooms.

segment.source: Also, make cloud services that are causing pain for the users a higher priority.
segment.target: Also, make cloud services that are causing pain for the users a higher priority.

segment.source: For example, if users experience outages with a specific cloud service, then make migration of that cloud service a higher priority.
segment.target: For example, if users experience outages with a specific cloud service, then make migration of that cloud service a higher priority.

segment.source: Focus on the migration of higher priority cloud services first and put less effort into the migration of lower priority cloud services.
segment.target: Focus on the migration of higher priority cloud services first and put less effort into the migration of lower priority cloud services.

segment.source: There may be some cloud services that are unnecessary and you can remove them from your list of cloud services to migrate entirely.
segment.target: There may be some cloud services that are unnecessary and you can remove them from your list of cloud services to migrate entirely.

segment.source: Record the cloud service migration priority in the list of cloud services you plan to migrate.
segment.target: Record the cloud service migration priority in the list of cloud services you plan to migrate.

segment.source: Select cloud services migration strategy
segment.target: Select cloud services migration strategy

segment.source: When you deploy the Windows devices, should you migrate the faculty, staff, and students to the new cloud services?
segment.target: When you deploy the Windows devices, should you migrate the faculty, staff, and students to the new cloud services?

segment.source: Perhaps.
segment.target: Perhaps.

segment.source: But, in most instances you will want to select a migration strategy that introduces a number of small changes over a period of time.
segment.target: But, in most instances you will want to select a migration strategy that introduces a number of small changes over a period of time.

segment.source: Consider the following when you create your cloud services migration strategy:
segment.target: Consider the following when you create your cloud services migration strategy:

segment.source: Introduce small changes.
segment.target: Introduce small changes.

segment.source: The move from Chrome OS to Windows will be simple for most users as most will have exposure to Windows from home, friends, or family.
segment.target: The move from Chrome OS to Windows will be simple for most users as most will have exposure to Windows from home, friends, or family.

segment.source: However, users may not be as familiar with the apps or cloud services.
segment.target: However, users may not be as familiar with the apps or cloud services.

segment.source: Consider the move to Windows first, and then make other changes as time progresses.
segment.target: Consider the move to Windows first, and then make other changes as time progresses.

segment.source: Start off by using existing apps and cloud services.
segment.target: Start off by using existing apps and cloud services.

segment.source: Immediately after the migration to Windows devices, you may want to consider running the existing apps and cloud services (such Google Apps, Google Apps Gmail, and Google Drive).
segment.target: Immediately after the migration to Windows devices, you may want to consider running the existing apps and cloud services (such Google Apps, Google Apps Gmail, and Google Drive).

segment.source: This gives users a familiar method to perform their day-to-day tasks.
segment.target: This gives users a familiar method to perform their day-to-day tasks.

segment.source: Resolve pain points.
segment.target: Resolve pain points.

segment.source: If some existing apps or cloud services cause problems, you may want to migrate them sooner rather than later.
segment.target: If some existing apps or cloud services cause problems, you may want to migrate them sooner rather than later.

segment.source: In most instances, users will be happy to go through the learning curve of a new app or cloud service if it is more reliable or intuitive for them to use.
segment.target: In most instances, users will be happy to go through the learning curve of a new app or cloud service if it is more reliable or intuitive for them to use.

segment.source: Migrate classrooms or users with common curriculum.
segment.target: Migrate classrooms or users with common curriculum.

segment.source: Migrate to Windows devices for an entire classroom or for multiple classrooms that share common curriculum.
segment.target: Migrate to Windows devices for an entire classroom or for multiple classrooms that share common curriculum.

segment.source: You must ensure that the necessary apps and cloud services are available for the curriculum prior to the migration of one or more classrooms.
segment.target: You must ensure that the necessary apps and cloud services are available for the curriculum prior to the migration of one or more classrooms.

segment.source: Migrate when the fewest number of active users are affected.
segment.target: Migrate when the fewest number of active users are affected.

segment.source: Migrate your cloud services at the end of an academic year or end of a semester.
segment.target: Migrate your cloud services at the end of an academic year or end of a semester.

segment.source: This will ensure you have minimal impact on faculty, staff, and students.
segment.target: This will ensure you have minimal impact on faculty, staff, and students.

segment.source: Also, a migration during this time will minimize the learning curve for users as they are probably dealing with new curriculum for the next semester.
segment.target: Also, a migration during this time will minimize the learning curve for users as they are probably dealing with new curriculum for the next semester.

segment.source: Also, you may not need to migrate student apps and data because many educational institutions do not preserve data between semesters or academic years.
segment.target: Also, you may not need to migrate student apps and data because many educational institutions do not preserve data between semesters or academic years.

segment.source: Overlap existing and new cloud services.
segment.target: Overlap existing and new cloud services.

segment.source: For faculty and staff, consider overlapping the existing and new cloud services (having both services available) for one business cycle (end of semester or academic year) after migration.
segment.target: For faculty and staff, consider overlapping the existing and new cloud services (having both services available) for one business cycle (end of semester or academic year) after migration.

segment.source: This allows you to easily recover any data that might not have migrated successfully from the existing cloud services.
segment.target: This allows you to easily recover any data that might not have migrated successfully from the existing cloud services.

segment.source: At a minimum, overlap the user of existing and new cloud services until the user can verify the migration.
segment.target: At a minimum, overlap the user of existing and new cloud services until the user can verify the migration.

segment.source: Of course, the tradeoff for using this strategy is the cost of the existing cloud services.
segment.target: Of course, the tradeoff for using this strategy is the cost of the existing cloud services.

segment.source: However, depending on when license renewal occurs, the cost may be minimal.
segment.target: However, depending on when license renewal occurs, the cost may be minimal.

segment.source: Plan for Windows device deployment
segment.target: Plan for Windows device deployment

segment.source: You need to plan for Windows device deployment to help ensure that the devices are successfully installed and configured to replace the Chromebook devices.
segment.target: You need to plan for Windows device deployment to help ensure that the devices are successfully installed and configured to replace the Chromebook devices.

segment.source: Even if the vendor that provides the devices pre-loads Windows 10 on them, you still will need to perform other tasks.
segment.target: Even if the vendor that provides the devices pre-loads Windows 10 on them, you still will need to perform other tasks.

segment.source: In this section you will select a Windows device deployment strategy; plan for Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) and Azure AD services; plan for device, user, and app management; and plan for any necessary network infrastructure remediation.
segment.target: In this section you will select a Windows device deployment strategy; plan for Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) and Azure AD services; plan for device, user, and app management; and plan for any necessary network infrastructure remediation.

segment.source: Select a Windows device deployment strategy
segment.target: Select a Windows device deployment strategy

segment.source: What decisions need to be made about Windows device deployment?
segment.target: What decisions need to be made about Windows device deployment?

segment.source: You just put the device on a desk, hook up power, connect to Wi-Fi, and then let the users operate the device, right?
segment.target: You just put the device on a desk, hook up power, connect to Wi-Fi, and then let the users operate the device, right?

segment.source: That is essentially correct, but depending on the extent of your deployment and other factors, you need to consider different deployment strategies.
segment.target: That is essentially correct, but depending on the extent of your deployment and other factors, you need to consider different deployment strategies.

segment.source: For each classroom that has Chromebook devices, select a combination of the following device deployment strategies:
segment.target: For each classroom that has Chromebook devices, select a combination of the following device deployment strategies:

segment.source: Deploy one classroom at a time.
segment.target: Deploy one classroom at a time.

segment.source: In most cases you will want to perform your deployment in batches of devices and a classroom is an excellent way to batch devices.
segment.target: In most cases you will want to perform your deployment in batches of devices and a classroom is an excellent way to batch devices.

segment.source: You can treat each classroom as a unit and check each classroom off your list after you have deployed the devices.
segment.target: You can treat each classroom as a unit and check each classroom off your list after you have deployed the devices.

segment.source: Deploy based on curriculum.
segment.target: Deploy based on curriculum.

segment.source: Deploy the Windows devices after you have confirmed that the curriculum is ready for the Windows devices.
segment.target: Deploy the Windows devices after you have confirmed that the curriculum is ready for the Windows devices.

segment.source: If you deploy Windows devices without the curriculum installed and tested, you could significantly reduce the ability for students and teachers to perform effectively in the classroom.
segment.target: If you deploy Windows devices without the curriculum installed and tested, you could significantly reduce the ability for students and teachers to perform effectively in the classroom.

segment.source: Also, deployment based on curriculum has the advantage of letting you move from classroom to classroom quickly if multiple classrooms use the same curriculum.
segment.target: Also, deployment based on curriculum has the advantage of letting you move from classroom to classroom quickly if multiple classrooms use the same curriculum.

segment.source: Deploy side-by-side.
segment.target: Deploy side-by-side.

segment.source: In some instances you may need to have both the Chromebook and Windows devices in one or more classrooms.
segment.target: In some instances you may need to have both the Chromebook and Windows devices in one or more classrooms.

segment.source: You can use this strategy if some of the curriculum only works on Chromebook and other parts of the curriculum works on Windows devices.
segment.target: You can use this strategy if some of the curriculum only works on Chromebook and other parts of the curriculum works on Windows devices.

segment.source: This is a good method to help prevent delays in Windows device deployment, while ensuring that students and teachers can make optimal use of technology in their curriculum.
segment.target: This is a good method to help prevent delays in Windows device deployment, while ensuring that students and teachers can make optimal use of technology in their curriculum.

segment.source: Deploy after apps and cloud services migration.
segment.target: Deploy after apps and cloud services migration.

segment.source: If you deploy a Windows device without the necessary apps and cloud services to support the curriculum, this provides only a portion of your complete solution.
segment.target: If you deploy a Windows device without the necessary apps and cloud services to support the curriculum, this provides only a portion of your complete solution.

segment.source: Ensure that the apps and cloud services are tested, provisioned, and ready for use prior to the deployment of Windows devices.
segment.target: Ensure that the apps and cloud services are tested, provisioned, and ready for use prior to the deployment of Windows devices.

segment.source: Deploy after the migration of user and device settings.
segment.target: Deploy after the migration of user and device settings.

segment.source: Ensure that you have identified the user and device settings that you plan to migrate and that those settings are ready to be applied to the new Windows devices.
segment.target: Ensure that you have identified the user and device settings that you plan to migrate and that those settings are ready to be applied to the new Windows devices.

segment.source: For example, you would want to create Group Policy Objects (GPOs) to apply the user and device settings to Windows devices.
segment.target: For example, you would want to create Group Policy Objects (GPOs) to apply the user and device settings to Windows devices.

segment.source: If you ensure that Windows devices closely mirror the Chromebook device configuration, you will ease user learning curve and create a sense of familiarity.
segment.target: If you ensure that Windows devices closely mirror the Chromebook device configuration, you will ease user learning curve and create a sense of familiarity.

segment.source: Also, when you have the settings ready to be applied to the devices, it helps ensure you will deploy your new Windows devices in a secure configuration.
segment.target: Also, when you have the settings ready to be applied to the devices, it helps ensure you will deploy your new Windows devices in a secure configuration.

segment.source: Record the combination of Windows device deployment strategies that you selected.
segment.target: Record the combination of Windows device deployment strategies that you selected.

segment.source: Plan for AD DS and Azure AD services
segment.target: Plan for AD DS and Azure AD services

segment.source: The next decision you will need to make concerns AD DS and Azure AD services.
segment.target: The next decision you will need to make concerns AD DS and Azure AD services.

segment.source: You can run AD DS on-premises, in the cloud by using Azure AD, or a combination of both (hybrid).
segment.target: You can run AD DS on-premises, in the cloud by using Azure AD, or a combination of both (hybrid).

segment.source: The decision about which of these options is best is closely tied to how you will manage your users, apps, and devices and if you will use Office 365 and other Azure-based cloud services.
segment.target: The decision about which of these options is best is closely tied to how you will manage your users, apps, and devices and if you will use Office 365 and other Azure-based cloud services.

segment.source: In the hybrid configuration, your on-premises AD DS user and group objects are synchronized with Azure AD (including passwords).
segment.target: In the hybrid configuration, your on-premises AD DS user and group objects are synchronized with Azure AD (including passwords).

segment.source: The synchronization happens both directions so that changes are made in both your on-premises AD DS and Azure AD.
segment.target: The synchronization happens both directions so that changes are made in both your on-premises AD DS and Azure AD.

segment.source: Table 5 is a decision matrix that helps you decide if you can use only on-premises AD DS, only Azure AD, or a combination of both (hybrid).
segment.target: Table 5 is a decision matrix that helps you decide if you can use only on-premises AD DS, only Azure AD, or a combination of both (hybrid).

segment.source: If the requirements you select from the table require on-premises AD DS and Azure AD, then you should select hybrid.
segment.target: If the requirements you select from the table require on-premises AD DS and Azure AD, then you should select hybrid.

segment.source: For example, if you plan to use Office 365 and use Group Policy for management, then you would select hybrid.
segment.target: For example, if you plan to use Office 365 and use Group Policy for management, then you would select hybrid.

segment.source: However, if you plan to use Office 365 and use Intune for management, then you would select only Azure AD.
segment.target: However, if you plan to use Office 365 and use Intune for management, then you would select only Azure AD.

segment.source: Plan device, user, and app management

segment.source: You may ask the question, “Why plan for device, user, and app management before you deploy the device?”
segment.target: You may ask the question, “Why plan for device, user, and app management before you deploy the device?”

segment.source: The answer is that you will only deploy the device once, but you will manage the device throughout the remainder of the device's lifecycle.
segment.target: The answer is that you will only deploy the device once, but you will manage the device throughout the remainder of the device's lifecycle.

segment.source: Also, planning management before deployment is essential to being ready to support the devices as you deploy them.
segment.target: Also, planning management before deployment is essential to being ready to support the devices as you deploy them.

segment.source: You want to have your management processes and technology in place when the first teachers, facility, or students start using their new Windows device.
segment.target: You want to have your management processes and technology in place when the first teachers, facility, or students start using their new Windows device.

segment.source: Plan network infrastructure remediation
segment.target: Plan network infrastructure remediation

segment.source: In addition to AD DS, Azure AD, and management components, there are other network infrastructure services that Windows devices need.
segment.target: In addition to AD DS, Azure AD, and management components, there are other network infrastructure services that Windows devices need.

segment.source: In most instances, Windows devices have the same network infrastructure requirements as the existing Chromebook devices.
segment.target: In most instances, Windows devices have the same network infrastructure requirements as the existing Chromebook devices.

segment.source: Examine each of the following network infrastructure technologies and services and determine if any remediation is necessary:
segment.target: Examine each of the following network infrastructure technologies and services and determine if any remediation is necessary:

segment.source: Domain Name System (DNS) provides translation between a device name and its associated IP address.
segment.target: Domain Name System (DNS) provides translation between a device name and its associated IP address.

segment.source: For Chromebook devices, public facing, Internet DNS services are the most important.
segment.target: For Chromebook devices, public facing, Internet DNS services are the most important.

segment.source: For Windows devices that only access the Internet, they have the same requirements.
segment.target: For Windows devices that only access the Internet, they have the same requirements.

segment.source: However, if you intend to communicate between Windows devices (peer-to-peer or client/server) then you will need local DNS services.
segment.target: However, if you intend to communicate between Windows devices (peer-to-peer or client/server) then you will need local DNS services.

segment.source: Windows devices will register their name and IP address with the local DNS services so that Windows devices can locate each other.
segment.target: Windows devices will register their name and IP address with the local DNS services so that Windows devices can locate each other.

segment.source: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) provides automatic IP configuration for devices.
segment.target: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) provides automatic IP configuration for devices.

segment.source: Your existing Chromebook devices probably use DHCP for configuration.
segment.target: Your existing Chromebook devices probably use DHCP for configuration.

segment.source: If you plan to immediately replace the Chromebook devices with Windows devices, then you only need to release all the DHCP reservations for the Chromebook devices prior to the deployment of Windows devices.
segment.target: If you plan to immediately replace the Chromebook devices with Windows devices, then you only need to release all the DHCP reservations for the Chromebook devices prior to the deployment of Windows devices.

segment.source: If you plan to run Chromebook and Windows devices side-by-side, then you need to ensure that your DHCP service has adequate IP addresses available for both sets of devices.
segment.target: If you plan to run Chromebook and Windows devices side-by-side, then you need to ensure that your DHCP service has adequate IP addresses available for both sets of devices.

segment.source: Wi-Fi.
segment.target: Wi-Fi.

segment.source: Chromebook devices are designed to connect to Wi-Fi networks.
segment.target: Chromebook devices are designed to connect to Wi-Fi networks.

segment.source: Windows devices are the same.
segment.target: Windows devices are the same.

segment.source: Your existing Wi-Fi network for the Chromebook devices should be adequate for the same number of Windows devices.
segment.target: Your existing Wi-Fi network for the Chromebook devices should be adequate for the same number of Windows devices.

segment.source: If you plan to significantly increase the number of Windows devices or you plan to run Chromebook and Windows devices side-by-side, then you need to ensure that Wi-Fi network can support the number of devices.
segment.target: If you plan to significantly increase the number of Windows devices or you plan to run Chromebook and Windows devices side-by-side, then you need to ensure that Wi-Fi network can support the number of devices.

segment.source: Internet bandwidth.
segment.target: Internet bandwidth.

segment.source: Chromebook devices consume more Internet bandwidth (up to 700 times more) than Windows devices.
segment.target: Chromebook devices consume more Internet bandwidth (up to 700 times more) than Windows devices.

segment.source: This means that if your existing Internet bandwidth is adequate for the Chromebook devices, then the bandwidth will be more than adequate for Windows devices.
segment.target: This means that if your existing Internet bandwidth is adequate for the Chromebook devices, then the bandwidth will be more than adequate for Windows devices.

segment.source: However, if you plan to significantly increase the number of Windows devices or you plan to run Chromebook and Windows devices side-by-side, then you need to ensure that your Internet connection can support the number of devices.
segment.target: However, if you plan to significantly increase the number of Windows devices or you plan to run Chromebook and Windows devices side-by-side, then you need to ensure that your Internet connection can support the number of devices.

segment.source: For more information that compares Internet bandwidth consumption for Chromebook and Windows devices, see the following resources:
segment.target: For more information that compares Internet bandwidth consumption for Chromebook and Windows devices, see the following resources:

segment.source: Chromebook vs. Windows Notebook Network Traffic Analysis
segment.target: Chromebook vs. Windows Notebook Network Traffic Analysis

segment.source: Hidden Cost of Chromebook Deployments
segment.target: Hidden Cost of Chromebook Deployments

segment.source: Microsoft Windows 8.1 Notebook vs. Chromebooks for Education
segment.target: Microsoft Windows 8.1 Notebook vs. Chromebooks for Education

segment.source: Power.
segment.target: Power.

segment.source: Although not specifically a network infrastructure, you need to ensure your classrooms have adequate power.
segment.target: Although not specifically a network infrastructure, you need to ensure your classrooms have adequate power.

segment.source: Chromebook and Windows devices should consume similar amounts of power.
segment.target: Chromebook and Windows devices should consume similar amounts of power.

segment.source: This means that your existing power outlets should support the same number of Windows devices.
segment.target: This means that your existing power outlets should support the same number of Windows devices.

segment.source: If you plan to significantly increase the number of Windows devices or you plan to run Chromebook and Windows devices side-by-side, you need to ensure that the power outlets, power strips, and other power management components can support the number of devices.
segment.target: If you plan to significantly increase the number of Windows devices or you plan to run Chromebook and Windows devices side-by-side, you need to ensure that the power outlets, power strips, and other power management components can support the number of devices.

segment.source: At the end of this process, you may determine that no network infrastructure remediation is necessary.
segment.target: At the end of this process, you may determine that no network infrastructure remediation is necessary.

segment.source: If so, you can skip the Perform network infrastructure remediation section of this guide.
segment.target: If so, you can skip the Perform network infrastructure remediation section of this guide.

segment.source: Perform Chromebook migration
segment.target: Perform Chromebook migration

segment.source: Thus far, planning has been the primary focus.
segment.target: Thus far, planning has been the primary focus.

segment.source: Believe it or not most of the work is now done.
segment.target: Believe it or not most of the work is now done.

segment.source: The rest of the Chromebook migration is just the implementation of the plan you have created.
segment.target: The rest of the Chromebook migration is just the implementation of the plan you have created.

segment.source: In this section you will perform the necessary steps for the Chromebook device migration.
segment.target: In this section you will perform the necessary steps for the Chromebook device migration.

segment.source: You will perform the migration based on the planning decision that you made in the Plan Chromebook migration section earlier in this guide.
segment.target: You will perform the migration based on the planning decision that you made in the Plan Chromebook migration section earlier in this guide.

segment.source: You must perform some of the steps in this section in a specific sequence.
segment.target: You must perform some of the steps in this section in a specific sequence.

segment.target: Each section has guidance about when to perform a step.

segment.source: You can perform other steps before, during, or after the migration.
segment.target: You can perform other steps before, during, or after the migration.

segment.source: Again, each section will tell you if the sequence is important.
segment.target: Again, each section will tell you if the sequence is important.

segment.source: Perform migration of user and device settings
segment.target: Perform migration of user and device settings

segment.source: In the Plan for migration of user and device settings section, you determined the user and device settings that you want to migrate.
segment.target: In the Plan for migration of user and device settings section, you determined the user and device settings that you want to migrate.

segment.source: You selected settings that are configured in the Google Admin Console and locally on the Chromebook device.
segment.target: You selected settings that are configured in the Google Admin Console and locally on the Chromebook device.

segment.source: Perform the user and device setting migration by using the following steps:
segment.target: Perform the user and device setting migration by using the following steps:

segment.source: From the list of institution-wide settings that you created in the Plan for migration of user and device settings section, configure as many as possible in your management system (such as Group Policy, Configuration Manager, or Intune).
segment.target: From the list of institution-wide settings that you created in the Plan for migration of user and device settings section, configure as many as possible in your management system (such as Group Policy, Configuration Manager, or Intune).

segment.source: From the list of device-specific settings that you created in the Plan for migration of user and device settings section, configure device-specific setting for higher priority settings.
segment.target: From the list of device-specific settings that you created in the Plan for migration of user and device settings section, configure device-specific setting for higher priority settings.

segment.source: From the list of user-specific settings that you created in the Plan for migration of user and device settings section, configure user-specific setting for higher priority settings.
segment.target: From the list of user-specific settings that you created in the Plan for migration of user and device settings section, configure user-specific setting for higher priority settings.

segment.source: Verify that all higher-priority user and device settings have been configured in your management system.
segment.target: Verify that all higher-priority user and device settings have been configured in your management system.

segment.source: If you do no want to migrate any user or device settings from the Chromebook devices to the Windows devices, you can skip this section.
segment.target: If you do no want to migrate any user or device settings from the Chromebook devices to the Windows devices, you can skip this section.

segment.source: Perform email migration
segment.target: Perform email migration

segment.source: In the Plan for email migration section, you identified the user mailboxes to migrate, identified the companion devices that access Google Apps Gmail, and identified the optimal timing for migration.
segment.target: In the Plan for email migration section, you identified the user mailboxes to migrate, identified the companion devices that access Google Apps Gmail, and identified the optimal timing for migration.

segment.source: You can perform this migration before or after you deploy the Windows devices.
segment.target: You can perform this migration before or after you deploy the Windows devices.

segment.source: Office 365 supports automated migration from Google Apps Gmail to Office 365.
segment.target: Office 365 supports automated migration from Google Apps Gmail to Office 365.

segment.source: For more information on how to automate the migration from Google Apps Gmail to Office 365, see Migrate Google Apps mailboxes to Office 365.
segment.target: For more information on how to automate the migration from Google Apps Gmail to Office 365, see Migrate Google Apps mailboxes to Office 365.

segment.source: Alternatively, if you want to migrate to Office 365 from:
segment.target: Alternatively, if you want to migrate to Office 365 from:

segment.source: On-premises Microsoft Exchange Server.
segment.target: On-premises Microsoft Exchange Server.

segment.source: Use the following resources to migrate to Office 365 from an on-premises Microsoft Exchange Server:
segment.target: Use the following resources to migrate to Office 365 from an on-premises Microsoft Exchange Server:

segment.source: Cutover Exchange Migration and Single Sign-On
segment.target: Cutover Exchange Migration and Single Sign-On

segment.source: Step-By-Step: Migration of Exchange 2003 Server to Office 365
segment.target: Step-By-Step: Migration of Exchange 2003 Server to Office 365

segment.source: Step-By-Step: Migrating from Exchange 2007 to Office 365
segment.target: Step-By-Step: Migrating from Exchange 2007 to Office 365

segment.source: Another on-premises or cloud-based email service.
segment.target: Another on-premises or cloud-based email service.

segment.source: Follow the guidance from that vendor.
segment.target: Follow the guidance from that vendor.

segment.source: Perform cloud storage migration
segment.target: Perform cloud storage migration

segment.source: In the Plan for cloud storage migration section, you identified the cloud storage services currently in use, selected the Microsoft cloud storage services that you will use, and optimized your cloud storage services migration plan.
segment.target: In the Plan for cloud storage migration section, you identified the cloud storage services currently in use, selected the Microsoft cloud storage services that you will use, and optimized your cloud storage services migration plan.

segment.source: You can perform the cloud storage migration before or after you deploy the Windows devices.
segment.target: You can perform the cloud storage migration before or after you deploy the Windows devices.

segment.source: Manually migrate the cloud storage migration by using the following steps:
segment.target: Manually migrate the cloud storage migration by using the following steps:

segment.source: Install both Google Drive app and OneDrive for Business or OneDrive app on a device.
segment.target: Install both Google Drive app and OneDrive for Business or OneDrive app on a device.

segment.source: Sign in as the user in the Google Drive app.
segment.target: Sign in as the user in the Google Drive app.

segment.source: Sign in as the user in the OneDrive for Business or OneDrive app.
segment.target: Sign in as the user in the OneDrive for Business or OneDrive app.

segment.source: Copy the data from the Google Drive storage to the OneDrive for Business or OneDrive storage.
segment.target: Copy the data from the Google Drive storage to the OneDrive for Business or OneDrive storage.

segment.source: Optionally uninstall the Google Drive app.
segment.target: Optionally uninstall the Google Drive app.

segment.source: There are also a number of software vendors who provide software that helps automate the migration from Google Drive to OneDrive for Business, Office 365 SharePoint, or OneDrive.
segment.target: There are also a number of software vendors who provide software that helps automate the migration from Google Drive to OneDrive for Business, Office 365 SharePoint, or OneDrive.

segment.source: For more information about these automated migration tools, contact the vendors.
segment.target: For more information about these automated migration tools, contact the vendors.

segment.source: Perform cloud services migration
segment.target: Perform cloud services migration

segment.source: In the Plan for cloud services migrationsection, you identified the cloud services currently in use, selected the cloud services that you want to migrate, prioritized the cloud services to migrate, and then selected the cloud services migration strategy.
segment.target: In the Plan for cloud services migrationsection, you identified the cloud services currently in use, selected the cloud services that you want to migrate, prioritized the cloud services to migrate, and then selected the cloud services migration strategy.

segment.source: You can perform the cloud services migration before or after you deploy the Windows devices.
segment.target: You can perform the cloud services migration before or after you deploy the Windows devices.

segment.source: Migrate the cloud services that you currently use to the Microsoft cloud services that you selected.
segment.target: Migrate the cloud services that you currently use to the Microsoft cloud services that you selected.

segment.source: For example, you could migrate from a collaboration website to Office 365 SharePoint.
segment.target: For example, you could migrate from a collaboration website to Office 365 SharePoint.

segment.source: Perform the cloud services migration based on the existing cloud services and the Microsoft cloud services that you selected.
segment.target: Perform the cloud services migration based on the existing cloud services and the Microsoft cloud services that you selected.

segment.source: There are also a number of software vendors who provide software that helps automate the migration from other cloud services to Microsoft cloud services.
segment.target: There are also a number of software vendors who provide software that helps automate the migration from other cloud services to Microsoft cloud services.

segment.source: For more information about these automated migration tools, contact the vendors.
segment.target: For more information about these automated migration tools, contact the vendors.

segment.source: Perform Windows device deployment
segment.target: Perform Windows device deployment

segment.source: In the Select a Windows device deployment strategy section, you selected how you wanted to deploy Windows 10 devices.
segment.target: In the Select a Windows device deployment strategy section, you selected how you wanted to deploy Windows 10 devices.

segment.source: The other migration task that you designed in the Plan for Windows device deployment section have already been performed.
segment.target: The other migration task that you designed in the Plan for Windows device deployment section have already been performed.

segment.source: Now it's time to deploy the actual devices.
segment.target: Now it's time to deploy the actual devices.

segment.source: For example, if you selected to deploy Windows devices by each classroom, start with the first classroom and then proceed through all of the classrooms until you’ve deployed all Windows devices.
segment.target: For example, if you selected to deploy Windows devices by each classroom, start with the first classroom and then proceed through all of the classrooms until you’ve deployed all Windows devices.

segment.source: In some instances, you may receive the devices with Windows 10 already deployed, and want to use provisioning packages.
segment.target: In some instances, you may receive the devices with Windows 10 already deployed, and want to use provisioning packages.

segment.source: In other cases, you may have a custom Windows 10 image that you want to deploy to the devices by using Configuration Manager and/or MDT.
segment.target: In other cases, you may have a custom Windows 10 image that you want to deploy to the devices by using Configuration Manager and/or MDT.

segment.source: For information on how to deploy Windows 10 images to the devices, see the following resources:
segment.target: For information on how to deploy Windows 10 images to the devices, see the following resources:

segment.target: Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer

segment.source: Operating System Deployment in Configuration Manager
segment.target: Operating System Deployment in Configuration Manager

segment.source: In addition to the Windows 10 image deployment, you may need to perform the following tasks as a part of device deployment:
segment.target: In addition to the Windows 10 image deployment, you may need to perform the following tasks as a part of device deployment:

segment.source: Enroll the device with your management system.
segment.target: Enroll the device with your management system.

segment.source: Ensure that Windows Defender is enabled and configured to receive updates.
segment.target: Ensure that Windows Defender is enabled and configured to receive updates.

segment.source: Ensure that Windows Update is enabled and configured to receive updates.
segment.target: Ensure that Windows Update is enabled and configured to receive updates.

segment.source: Deploy any apps that you want the user to immediately be able to access when they start the device (such as Word 2016 or Excel 2016).
segment.target: Deploy any apps that you want the user to immediately be able to access when they start the device (such as Word 2016 or Excel 2016).

segment.source: After you complete these steps, your management system should take over the day-to-day maintenance tasks for the Windows 10 devices.
segment.target: After you complete these steps, your management system should take over the day-to-day maintenance tasks for the Windows 10 devices.

segment.source: Verify that the user and device settings migrated correctly as you deploy each batch of Windows 10 devices.
segment.target: Verify that the user and device settings migrated correctly as you deploy each batch of Windows 10 devices.

segment.source: Continue this process until you deploy all Windows 10 devices.
segment.target: Continue this process until you deploy all Windows 10 devices.
